cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
who was the drummer with the travelling wilburys
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: The Traveling Wilburys were a supergroup formed in the late 1980s, consisting of several well-known musicians. The group included Bob Dylan, George Harrison, Jeff Lynne, Roy Orbison, and Tom Petty. While they had a collaborative approach to their music, they did not have a dedicated drummer as part of the group. Instead, they often used session musicians for drumming on their recordings. However, for live performances, they typically relied on additional musicians to fill in the roles. 

Answer: The Traveling Wilburys did not have a dedicated drummer; they used session musicians for drumming.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who was the drummer with the travelling wilburys

['The Traveling Wilburys (sometimes shortened to the Wilburys) were an English–American supergroup consisting of Bob Dylan, George Harrison, Jeff Lynne, Roy Orbison and Tom Petty. Originating from an idea discussed by Harrison and Lynne during the sessions for Harrison\'s 1987 album "Cloud Nine", the band formed in April 1988 after the five members united to record a bonus track for Harrison\'s next European single. When this collaboration, "Handle with Care", was deemed too good for such a limited release, the group agreed to record a full album, titled "Traveling Wilburys Vol. 1". Following Orbison\'s death in December 1988, the band released a second album, which they titled "Traveling Wilburys Vol. 3", in 1990.\n', 'The Traveling Wilburys Vol. 1 is the debut studio album by the English-American supergroup Traveling Wilburys, comprising George Harrison, Jeff Lynne, Bob Dylan, Roy Orbison and Tom Petty. It was released in October 1988 to commercial success and critical acclaim. Although Harrison had long planned to start such a band, the project came about through happenstance. Harrison was in Los Angeles and in need of a B-side for a single from his "Cloud Nine" album, which resulted in the participants collaborating informally on the song "Handle with Care" at Dylan\'s home. Adopting alter egos as the five Wilbury brothers, they then recorded a full album, produced by Lynne and Harrison.\n', 'BULLET::::- Jim Keltner, drummer for the Traveling Wilburys\n', 'The Traveling Wilburys\n', 'The Traveling Wilburys consisted of four notable singers with decades of success behind them - George Harrison (The Beatles), Tom Petty (Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers), Jeff Lynne (ELO) and Bob Dylan. "The Traveling Wilburys Collection" was a boxset of their two studio albums ("Traveling Wilburys Vol. 1" and "Traveling Wilburys Vol. 3"), neither of which reached the top ten on their first release in 1988 and 1990 respectively.\n']

The drummer with the Traveling Wilburys was Jim Keltner.

question_info.question: who was the drummer with the travelling wilburys
passages:
The Traveling Wilburys (sometimes shortened to the Wilburys) were an English–American supergroup consisting of Bob Dylan, George Harrison, Jeff Lynne, Roy Orbison and Tom Petty. Originating from an idea discussed by Harrison and Lynne during the sessions for Harrison's 1987 album "Cloud Nine", the band formed in April 1988 after the five members united to record a bonus track for Harrison's next European single. When this collaboration, "Handle with Care", was deemed too good for such a limited release, the group agreed to record a full album, titled "Traveling Wilburys Vol. 1". Following Orbison's death in December 1988, the band released a second album, which they titled "Traveling Wilburys Vol. 3", in 1990.
The Traveling Wilburys Vol. 1 is the debut studio album by the English-American supergroup Traveling Wilburys, comprising George Harrison, Jeff Lynne, Bob Dylan, Roy Orbison and Tom Petty. It was released in October 1988 to commercial success and critical acclaim. Although Harrison had long planned to start such a band, the project came about through happenstance. Harrison was in Los Angeles and in need of a B-side for a single from his "Cloud Nine" album, which resulted in the participants collaborating informally on the song "Handle with Care" at Dylan's home. Adopting alter egos as the five Wilbury brothers, they then recorded a full album, produced by Lynne and Harrison.
BULLET::::- Jim Keltner, drummer for the Traveling Wilburys
The Traveling Wilburys
The Traveling Wilburys consisted of four notable singers with decades of success behind them - George Harrison (The Beatles), Tom Petty (Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers), Jeff Lynne (ELO) and Bob Dylan. "The Traveling Wilburys Collection" was a boxset of their two studio albums ("Traveling Wilburys Vol. 1" and "Traveling Wilburys Vol. 3"), neither of which reached the top ten on their first release in 1988 and 1990 respectively.
